9 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------/
10 / FatFs - FAT file system module R0.10b (C)ChaN, 2014
11 /-----------------------------------------------------------------------------/
12 / FatFs module is a generic FAT file system module for small embedded systems.
13 / This is a free software that opened for education, research and commercial
14 / developments under license policy of following terms.
15 /
16 / Copyright (C) 2014, ChaN, all right reserved.
17 /
18 / * The FatFs module is a free software and there is NO WARRANTY.
19 / * No restriction on use. You can use, modify and redistribute it for
20 / personal, non-profit or commercial products UNDER YOUR RESPONSIBILITY.
21 / * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice.
22 /
23 /-----------------------------------------------------------------------------/
24 / Feb 26,'06 R0.00 Prototype.
25 /
26 / Apr 29,'06 R0.01 First stable version.
27 /
28 / Jun 01,'06 R0.02 Added FAT12 support.
29 / Removed unbuffered mode.
30 / Fixed a problem on small (<32M) partition.
31 / Jun 10,'06 R0.02a Added a configuration option (_FS_MINIMUM).
32 /
33 / Sep 22,'06 R0.03 Added f_rename().
34 / Changed option _FS_MINIMUM to _FS_MINIMIZE.
35 / Dec 11,'06 R0.03a Improved cluster scan algorithm to write files fast.
36 / Fixed f_mkdir() creates incorrect directory on FAT32.
37 /
38 / Feb 04,'07 R0.04 Supported multiple drive system.
39 / Changed some interfaces for multiple drive system.
40 / Changed f_mountdrv() to f_mount().
41 / Added f_mkfs().
42 / Apr 01,'07 R0.04a Supported multiple partitions on a physical drive.
43 / Added a capability of extending file size to f_lseek().
44 / Added minimization level 3.
45 / Fixed an endian sensitive code in f_mkfs().
46 / May 05,'07 R0.04b Added a configuration option _USE_NTFLAG.
47 / Added FSINFO support.
48 / Fixed DBCS name can result FR_INVALID_NAME.
49 / Fixed short seek (<= csize) collapses the file object.
50 /
51 / Aug 25,'07 R0.05 Changed arguments of f_read(), f_write() and f_mkfs().
52 / Fixed f_mkfs() on FAT32 creates incorrect FSINFO.
53 / Fixed f_mkdir() on FAT32 creates incorrect directory.
54 / Feb 03,'08 R0.05a Added f_truncate() and f_utime().
55 / Fixed off by one error at FAT sub-type determination.
56 / Fixed btr in f_read() can be mistruncated.
57 / Fixed cached sector is not flushed when create and close without write.
58 /
59 / Apr 01,'08 R0.06 Added fputc(), fputs(), fprintf() and fgets().
60 / Improved performance of f_lseek() on moving to the same or following cluster.
61 /
62 / Apr 01,'09 R0.07 Merged Tiny-FatFs as a configuration option. (_FS_TINY)
63 / Added long file name feature.
64 / Added multiple code page feature.
65 / Added re-entrancy for multitask operation.
66 / Added auto cluster size selection to f_mkfs().
67 / Added rewind option to f_readdir().
68 / Changed result code of critical errors.
69 / Renamed string functions to avoid name collision.
70 / Apr 14,'09 R0.07a Separated out OS dependent code on reentrant cfg.
71 / Added multiple sector size feature.
72 / Jun 21,'09 R0.07c Fixed f_unlink() can return FR_OK on error.
73 / Fixed wrong cache control in f_lseek().
74 / Added relative path feature.
75 / Added f_chdir() and f_chdrive().
76 / Added proper case conversion to extended character.
77 / Nov 03,'09 R0.07e Separated out configuration options from ff.h to ffconf.h.
78 / Fixed f_unlink() fails to remove a sub-directory on _FS_RPATH.
79 / Fixed name matching error on the 13 character boundary.
80 / Added a configuration option, _LFN_UNICODE.
81 / Changed f_readdir() to return the SFN with always upper case on non-LFN cfg.
82 /
83 / May 15,'10 R0.08 Added a memory configuration option. (_USE_LFN = 3)
84 / Added file lock feature. (_FS_SHARE)
85 / Added fast seek feature. (_USE_FASTSEEK)
86 / Changed some types on the API, XCHAR->TCHAR.
87 / Changed .fname in the FILINFO structure on Unicode cfg.
88 / String functions support UTF-8 encoding files on Unicode cfg.
89 / Aug 16,'10 R0.08a Added f_getcwd().
90 / Added sector erase feature. (_USE_ERASE)
91 / Moved file lock semaphore table from fs object to the bss.
92 / Fixed a wrong directory entry is created on non-LFN cfg when the given name contains ';'.
93 / Fixed f_mkfs() creates wrong FAT32 volume.
94 / Jan 15,'11 R0.08b Fast seek feature is also applied to f_read() and f_write().
95 / f_lseek() reports required table size on creating CLMP.
96 / Extended format syntax of f_printf().
97 / Ignores duplicated directory separators in given path name.
98 /
99 / Sep 06,'11 R0.09 f_mkfs() supports multiple partition to complete the multiple partition feature.
100 / Added f_fdisk().
101 / Aug 27,'12 R0.09a Changed f_open() and f_opendir() reject null object pointer to avoid crash.
102 / Changed option name _FS_SHARE to _FS_LOCK.
103 / Fixed assertion failure due to OS/2 EA on FAT12/16 volume.
104 / Jan 24,'13 R0.09b Added f_setlabel() and f_getlabel().
105 /
106 / Oct 02,'13 R0.10 Added selection of character encoding on the file. (_STRF_ENCODE)
107 / Added f_closedir().
108 / Added forced full FAT scan for f_getfree(). (_FS_NOFSINFO)
109 / Added forced mount feature with changes of f_mount().
110 / Improved behavior of volume auto detection.
111 / Improved write throughput of f_puts() and f_printf().
112 / Changed argument of f_chdrive(), f_mkfs(), disk_read() and disk_write().
113 / Fixed f_write() can be truncated when the file size is close to 4GB.
114 / Fixed f_open(), f_mkdir() and f_setlabel() can return incorrect error code.
115 / Jan 15,'14 R0.10a Added arbitrary strings as drive number in the path name. (_STR_VOLUME_ID)
116 / Added a configuration option of minimum sector size. (_MIN_SS)
117 / 2nd argument of f_rename() can have a drive number and it will be ignored.
118 / Fixed f_mount() with forced mount fails when drive number is >= 1.
119 / Fixed f_close() invalidates the file object without volume lock.
120 / Fixed f_closedir() returns but the volume lock is left acquired.
121 / Fixed creation of an entry with LFN fails on too many SFN collisions.
122 / May 19,'14 R0.10b Fixed a hard error in the disk I/O layer can collapse the directory entry.
123 / Fixed LFN entry is not deleted on delete/rename an object with lossy converted SFN.
124 /---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/

140 /* Reentrancy related */
141 #if _FS_REENTRANT
142 #if _USE_LFN == 1
143 #error Static LFN work area cannot be used at thread-safe configuration.
144 #endif
145 #define ENTER_FF(fs) { if (!lock_fs(fs)) return FR_TIMEOUT; }
146 #define LEAVE_FF(fs, res) { unlock_fs(fs, res); return res; }
147 #else
148 #define ENTER_FF(fs)
149 #define LEAVE_FF(fs, res) return res
150 #endif
151 
152 #define ABORT(fs, res) { fp->err = (BYTE)(res); LEAVE_FF(fs, res); }
153 
154 /* Definitions of sector size */
155 #if (_MAX_SS < _MIN_SS) || (_MAX_SS != 512 && _MAX_SS != 1024 && _MAX_SS != 2048 && _MAX_SS != 4096) || (_MIN_SS != 512 && _MIN_SS != 1024 && _MIN_SS != 2048 && _MIN_SS != 4096)
156 #error Wrong sector size configuration.
157 #endif
158 #if _MAX_SS == _MIN_SS
159 #define SS(fs) ((UINT)_MAX_SS) /* Fixed sector size */
160 #else
161 #define SS(fs) ((fs)->ssize) /* Variable sector size */
162 #endif
163 
164 /* File access control feature */
165 #if _FS_LOCK
166 #if _FS_READONLY
167 #error _FS_LOCK must be 0 at read-only cfg.
168 #endif
169 typedef struct
170 {
171  FATFS *fs; /* Object ID 1, volume (NULL:blank entry) */
172  DWORD clu; /* Object ID 2, directory (0:root) */
173  WORD idx; /* Object ID 3, directory index */
174  WORD ctr; /* Object open counter, 0:none, 0x01..0xFF:read mode open count, 0x100:write mode */
175 } FILESEM;
176 #endif

394 /* Character code support macros */
395 #define IsUpper(c) (((c)>='A')&&((c)<='Z'))
396 #define IsLower(c) (((c)>='a')&&((c)<='z'))
397 #define IsDigit(c) (((c)>='0')&&((c)<='9'))
398 
399 #if _DF1S /* Code page is DBCS */
400 
401 #ifdef _DF2S /* Two 1st byte areas */
402 #define IsDBCS1(c) (((BYTE)(c) >= _DF1S && (BYTE)(c) <= _DF1E) || ((BYTE)(c) >= _DF2S && (BYTE)(c) <= _DF2E))
403 #else /* One 1st byte area */
404 #define IsDBCS1(c) ((BYTE)(c) >= _DF1S && (BYTE)(c) <= _DF1E)
405 #endif
406 
407 #ifdef _DS3S /* Three 2nd byte areas */
408 #define IsDBCS2(c) (((BYTE)(c) >= _DS1S && (BYTE)(c) <= _DS1E) || ((BYTE)(c) >= _DS2S && (BYTE)(c) <= _DS2E) || ((BYTE)(c) >= _DS3S && (BYTE)(c) <= _DS3E))
409 #else /* Two 2nd byte areas */
410 #define IsDBCS2(c) (((BYTE)(c) >= _DS1S && (BYTE)(c) <= _DS1E) || ((BYTE)(c) >= _DS2S && (BYTE)(c) <= _DS2E))
411 #endif

413 #else /* Code page is SBCS */
414 
415 #define IsDBCS1(c) 0
416 #define IsDBCS2(c) 0
417 #endif /* _DF1S */
418 
419 /* Name status flags */
420 #define NS 11 /* Index of name status byte in fn[] */
421 #define NS_LOSS 0x01 /* Out of 8.3 format */
422 #define NS_LFN 0x02 /* Force to create LFN entry */
423 #define NS_LAST 0x04 /* Last segment */
424 #define NS_BODY 0x08 /* Lower case flag (body) */
425 #define NS_EXT 0x10 /* Lower case flag (ext) */
426 #define NS_DOT 0x20 /* Dot entry */

428 /* FAT sub-type boundaries */
429 #define MIN_FAT16 4086U /* Minimum number of clusters for FAT16 */
430 #define MIN_FAT32 65526U /* Minimum number of clusters for FAT32 */
431 
432 /* FatFs refers the members in the FAT structures as byte array instead of
433 / structure member because the structure is not binary compatible between
434 / different platforms */
435 
436 #define BS_jmpBoot 0 /* Jump instruction (3) */
437 #define BS_OEMName 3 /* OEM name (8) */
438 #define BPB_BytsPerSec 11 /* Sector size [byte] (2) */
439 #define BPB_SecPerClus 13 /* Cluster size [sector] (1) */
440 #define BPB_RsvdSecCnt 14 /* Size of reserved area [sector] (2) */
441 #define BPB_NumFATs 16 /* Number of FAT copies (1) */
442 #define BPB_RootEntCnt 17 /* Number of root directory entries for FAT12/16 (2) */
443 #define BPB_TotSec16 19 /* Volume size [sector] (2) */
444 #define BPB_Media 21 /* Media descriptor (1) */
445 #define BPB_FATSz16 22 /* FAT size [sector] (2) */
446 #define BPB_SecPerTrk 24 /* Track size [sector] (2) */
447 #define BPB_NumHeads 26 /* Number of heads (2) */
448 #define BPB_HiddSec 28 /* Number of special hidden sectors (4) */
449 #define BPB_TotSec32 32 /* Volume size [sector] (4) */
450 #define BS_DrvNum 36 /* Physical drive number (2) */
451 #define BS_BootSig 38 /* Extended boot signature (1) */
452 #define BS_VolID 39 /* Volume serial number (4) */
453 #define BS_VolLab 43 /* Volume label (8) */
454 #define BS_FilSysType 54 /* File system type (1) */
455 #define BPB_FATSz32 36 /* FAT size [sector] (4) */
456 #define BPB_ExtFlags 40 /* Extended flags (2) */
457 #define BPB_FSVer 42 /* File system version (2) */
458 #define BPB_RootClus 44 /* Root directory first cluster (4) */
459 #define BPB_FSInfo 48 /* Offset of FSINFO sector (2) */
460 #define BPB_BkBootSec 50 /* Offset of backup boot sector (2) */
461 #define BS_DrvNum32 64 /* Physical drive number (2) */
462 #define BS_BootSig32 66 /* Extended boot signature (1) */
463 #define BS_VolID32 67 /* Volume serial number (4) */
464 #define BS_VolLab32 71 /* Volume label (8) */
465 #define BS_FilSysType32 82 /* File system type (1) */
466 #define FSI_LeadSig 0 /* FSI: Leading signature (4) */
467 #define FSI_StrucSig 484 /* FSI: Structure signature (4) */
468 #define FSI_Free_Count 488 /* FSI: Number of free clusters (4) */
469 #define FSI_Nxt_Free 492 /* FSI: Last allocated cluster (4) */
470 #define MBR_Table 446 /* MBR: Partition table offset (2) */
471 #define SZ_PTE 16 /* MBR: Size of a partition table entry */
472 #define BS_55AA 510 /* Signature word (2) */
473 
474 #define DIR_Name 0 /* Short file name (11) */
475 #define DIR_Attr 11 /* Attribute (1) */
476 #define DIR_NTres 12 /* NT flag (1) */
477 #define DIR_CrtTimeTenth 13 /* Created time sub-second (1) */
478 #define DIR_CrtTime 14 /* Created time (2) */
479 #define DIR_CrtDate 16 /* Created date (2) */

481 #define DIR_FstClusHI 20 /* Higher 16-bit of first cluster (2) */
482 #define DIR_WrtTime 22 /* Modified time (2) */
483 #define DIR_WrtDate 24 /* Modified date (2) */
484 #define DIR_FstClusLO 26 /* Lower 16-bit of first cluster (2) */
485 #define DIR_FileSize 28 /* File size (4) */

487 #define LDIR_Attr 11 /* LFN attribute (1) */
488 #define LDIR_Type 12 /* LFN type (1) */
489 #define LDIR_Chksum 13 /* Sum of corresponding SFN entry */
490 #define LDIR_FstClusLO 26 /* Filled by zero (0) */
491 #define SZ_DIR 32 /* Size of a directory entry */
492 #define LLE 0x40 /* Last long entry flag in LDIR_Ord */
493 #define DDE 0xE5 /* Deleted directory entry mark in DIR_Name[0] */
494 #define NDDE 0x05 /* Replacement of the character collides with DDE */

527 #define FREE_BUF()
528 
529 #elif _USE_LFN == 1 /* LFN feature with static working buffer */
530 static
531 WCHAR LfnBuf[_MAX_LFN+1];
532 #define DEF_NAMEBUF BYTE sfn[12]
533 #define INIT_BUF(dobj) { (dobj).fn = sfn; (dobj).lfn = LfnBuf; }
534 #define FREE_BUF()
535 
536 #elif _USE_LFN == 2 /* LFN feature with dynamic working buffer on the stack */
537 #define DEF_NAMEBUF BYTE sfn[12]; WCHAR lbuf[_MAX_LFN+1]
538 #define INIT_BUF(dobj) { (dobj).fn = sfn; (dobj).lfn = lbuf; }
539 #define FREE_BUF()
540 
541 #elif _USE_LFN == 3 /* LFN feature with dynamic working buffer on the heap */
542 #define DEF_NAMEBUF BYTE sfn[12]; WCHAR *lfn
543 #define INIT_BUF(dobj) { lfn = ff_memalloc((_MAX_LFN + 1) * 2); \
544 if (!lfn) LEAVE_FF((dobj).fs, FR_NOT_ENOUGH_CORE); \
545 (dobj).lfn = lfn; (dobj).fn = sfn; \
546 }
547 #define FREE_BUF() ff_memfree(lfn)
548 
549 #else
550 #error Wrong LFN configuration.
551 #endif

568 /* Copy memory to memory */
569 MEMSPACE
570 static
571 void mem_cpy (void* dst, const void* src, UINT cnt)
572 {
573  BYTE *d = (BYTE*)dst;
574  const BYTE *s = (const BYTE*)src;
575 
576 #if _WORD_ACCESS == 1
577  while (cnt >= sizeof (int))
578  {
579  *(int*)d = *(int*)s;
580  d += sizeof (int); s += sizeof (int);
581  cnt -= sizeof (int);
582  }
583 #endif
584  while (cnt--)
585  *d++ = *s++;
586 }
587 
588 
589 /* Fill memory */
590 MEMSPACE
591 static
592 void mem_set (void* dst, int val, UINT cnt)
593 {
594  BYTE *d = (BYTE*)dst;
595 
596  while (cnt--)
597  *d++ = (BYTE)val;
598 }
599 
600 
601 /* Compare memory to memory */
602 MEMSPACE
603 static
604 int mem_cmp (const void* dst, const void* src, UINT cnt)
605 {
606  const BYTE *d = (const BYTE *)dst, *s = (const BYTE *)src;
607  int r = 0;
608 
609  while (cnt-- && (r = *d++ - *s++) == 0) ;
610  return r;
611 }

614 /* Check if chr is contained in the string */
615 static
616 int chk_chr (const char* str, int chr)
617 {
618  while (*str && *str != chr) str++;
619  return *str;
620 }

637 MEMSPACE

639 void unlock_fs (

642 )
643 {

645  res != FR_NOT_ENABLED &&
646  res != FR_INVALID_DRIVE &&

654 
655 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
656 /* File lock control functions */
657 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
658 #if _FS_LOCK
659 
660 MEMSPACE
661 static
662 FRESULT chk_lock ( /* Check if the file can be accessed */
663 DIR* dp, /* Directory object pointing the file to be checked */
664 int acc /* Desired access type (0:Read, 1:Write, 2:Delete/Rename) */
665 )
666 {
667  UINT i, be;
668 
669 /* Search file semaphore table */
670  for (i = be = 0; i < _FS_LOCK; i++)
671  {
672  if (Files[i].fs) /* Existing entry */
673  {
674  if (Files[i].fs == dp->fs && /* Check if the object matched with an open object */
675  Files[i].clu == dp->sclust &&
676  Files[i].idx == dp->index) break;
677  } /* Blank entry */
678  else
679  {
680  be = 1;
681  }
682  }
683  if (i == _FS_LOCK) /* The object is not opened */
684 /* Is there a blank entry for new object? */
685  return (be || acc == 2) ? FR_OK : FR_TOO_MANY_OPEN_FILES;
686 
687 /* The object has been opened. Reject any open against writing file and all write mode open */
688  return (acc || Files[i].ctr == 0x100) ? FR_LOCKED : FR_OK;
689 }
690 
691 
692 MEMSPACE
693 static
694 int enq_lock (void) /* Check if an entry is available for a new object */
695 {
696  UINT i;
697 
698  for (i = 0; i < _FS_LOCK && Files[i].fs; i++) ;
699  return (i == _FS_LOCK) ? 0 : 1;
700 }
701 
702 
703 MEMSPACE
704 static
705 UINT inc_lock ( /* Increment object open counter and returns its index (0:Internal error) */
706 DIR* dp, /* Directory object pointing the file to register or increment */
707 int acc /* Desired access (0:Read, 1:Write, 2:Delete/Rename) */
708 )
709 {
710  UINT i;
711 
712  for (i = 0; i < _FS_LOCK; i++) /* Find the object */
713  {
714  if (Files[i].fs == dp->fs &&
715  Files[i].clu == dp->sclust &&
716  Files[i].idx == dp->index) break;
717  }
718 
719  if (i == _FS_LOCK) /* Not opened. Register it as new. */
720  {
721  for (i = 0; i < _FS_LOCK && Files[i].fs; i++) ;
722  if (i == _FS_LOCK) return 0; /* No free entry to register (int err) */
723  Files[i].fs = dp->fs;
724  Files[i].clu = dp->sclust;
725  Files[i].idx = dp->index;
726  Files[i].ctr = 0;
727  }
728 
729  if (acc && Files[i].ctr) return 0; /* Access violation (int err) */
730 
731  Files[i].ctr = acc ? 0x100 : Files[i].ctr + 1;/* Set semaphore value */
732 
733  return i + 1;
734 }
735 
736 
737 MEMSPACE
738 static
739 FRESULT dec_lock ( /* Decrement object open counter */
740 UINT i /* Semaphore index (1..) */
741 )
742 {
743  WORD n;
744  FRESULT res;
745 
746  if (--i < _FS_LOCK) /* Shift index number origin from 0 */
747  {
748  n = Files[i].ctr;
749  if (n == 0x100) n = 0; /* If write mode open, delete the entry */
750  if (n) n--; /* Decrement read mode open count */
751  Files[i].ctr = n;
752  if (!n) Files[i].fs = 0; /* Delete the entry if open count gets zero */
753  res = FR_OK;
754  }
755  else
756  {
757  res = FR_INT_ERR; /* Invalid index nunber */
758  }
759  return res;
760 }
761 
762 
763 MEMSPACE
764 static
765 void clear_lock ( /* Clear lock entries of the volume */
766 FATFS *fs
767 )
768 {
769  UINT i;
770 
771  for (i = 0; i < _FS_LOCK; i++)
772  {
773  if (Files[i].fs == fs) Files[i].fs = 0;
774  }
775 }
776 #endif
777 
778 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
779 /* Move/Flush disk access window in the file system object */
780 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
781 #if !_FS_READONLY
782 MEMSPACE
783 static
784 FRESULT sync_window (
785 FATFS* fs /* File system object */
786 )
787 {
788  DWORD wsect;
789  UINT nf;
790 
791  if (fs->wflag) /* Write back the sector if it is dirty */
792  {
793  wsect = fs->winsect; /* Current sector number */
794  if (disk_write(fs->drv, fs->win, wsect, 1))
795  return FR_DISK_ERR;
796  fs->wflag = 0;
797  if (wsect - fs->fatbase < fs->fsize) /* Is it in the FAT area? */
798  {
799  for (nf = fs->n_fats; nf >= 2; nf--) /* Reflect the change to all FAT copies */
800  {
801  wsect += fs->fsize;
802  disk_write(fs->drv, fs->win, wsect, 1);
803  }
804  }
805  }
806  return FR_OK;
807 }
808 #endif
809 
810 MEMSPACE
811 static
812 FRESULT move_window (
813 FATFS* fs, /* File system object */
814 DWORD sector /* Sector number to make appearance in the fs->win[] */
815 )
816 {
817  if (sector != fs->winsect) /* Changed current window */
818  {
819 #if !_FS_READONLY
820  if (sync_window(fs) != FR_OK)
821  return FR_DISK_ERR;
822 #endif
823  if (disk_read(fs->drv, fs->win, sector, 1))
824  return FR_DISK_ERR;
825  fs->winsect = sector;
826  }
827 
828  return FR_OK;
829 }
830 
831 
832 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
833 /* Synchronize file system and strage device */
834 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
835 #if !_FS_READONLY
836 MEMSPACE
837 static
838 FRESULT sync_fs ( /* FR_OK: successful, FR_DISK_ERR: failed */
839 FATFS* fs /* File system object */
840 )
841 {
842  FRESULT res;
843 
844  res = sync_window(fs);
845  if (res == FR_OK)
846  {
847 /* Update FSINFO sector if needed */
848  if (fs->fs_type == FS_FAT32 && fs->fsi_flag == 1)
849  {
850 /* Create FSINFO structure */
851  mem_set(fs->win, 0, SS(fs));
852  ST_WORD(fs->win+BS_55AA, 0xAA55);
853  ST_DWORD(fs->win+FSI_LeadSig, 0x41615252);
854  ST_DWORD(fs->win+FSI_StrucSig, 0x61417272);
855  ST_DWORD(fs->win+FSI_Free_Count, fs->free_clust);
856  ST_DWORD(fs->win+FSI_Nxt_Free, fs->last_clust);
857 /* Write it into the FSINFO sector */
858  fs->winsect = fs->volbase + 1;
859  disk_write(fs->drv, fs->win, fs->winsect, 1);
860  fs->fsi_flag = 0;
861  }
862 /* Make sure that no pending write process in the physical drive */
863  if (disk_ioctl(fs->drv, CTRL_SYNC, 0) != RES_OK)
864  res = FR_DISK_ERR;
865  }
866 
867  return res;
868 }
869 #endif
870 
871 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
872 /* Get sector# from cluster# */
873 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
874 
875 MEMSPACE
876 DWORD clust2sect ( /* !=0: Sector number, 0: Failed - invalid cluster# */
877 FATFS* fs, /* File system object */
878 DWORD clst /* Cluster# to be converted */
879 )
880 {
881  clst -= 2;
882  if (clst >= (fs->n_fatent - 2)) return 0; /* Invalid cluster# */
883  return clst * fs->csize + fs->database;
884 }
885 
886 
887 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
888 /* FAT access - Read value of a FAT entry */
889 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
890 
891 MEMSPACE
892 DWORD get_fat ( /* 0xFFFFFFFF:Disk error, 1:Internal error, Else:Cluster status */
893 FATFS* fs, /* File system object */
894 DWORD clst /* Cluster# to get the link information */
895 )
896 {
897  UINT wc, bc;
898  BYTE *p;
899 
900  if (clst < 2 || clst >= fs->n_fatent) /* Check range */
901  return 1;
902 
903  switch (fs->fs_type)
904  {
905  case FS_FAT12 :
906  bc = (UINT)clst; bc += bc / 2;
907  if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (bc / SS(fs)))) break;
908  wc = fs->win[bc % SS(fs)]; bc++;
909  if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (bc / SS(fs)))) break;
910  wc |= fs->win[bc % SS(fs)] << 8;
911  return clst & 1 ? wc >> 4 : (wc & 0xFFF);
912 
913  case FS_FAT16 :
914  if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 2)))) break;
915  p = &fs->win[clst * 2 % SS(fs)];
916  return LD_WORD(p);
917 
918  case FS_FAT32 :
919  if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 4)))) break;
920  p = &fs->win[clst * 4 % SS(fs)];
921  return LD_DWORD(p) & 0x0FFFFFFF;
922 
923  default:
924  return 1;
925  }
926 
927  return 0xFFFFFFFF; /* An error occurred at the disk I/O layer */
928 }
929 
930 
931 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
932 /* FAT access - Change value of a FAT entry */
933 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
934 #if !_FS_READONLY
935 
936 MEMSPACE
937 FRESULT put_fat (
938 FATFS* fs, /* File system object */
939 DWORD clst, /* Cluster# to be changed in range of 2 to fs->n_fatent - 1 */
940 DWORD val /* New value to mark the cluster */
941 )
942 {
943  UINT bc;
944  BYTE *p;
945  FRESULT res;
946 
947  if (clst < 2 || clst >= fs->n_fatent) /* Check range */
948  {
949  res = FR_INT_ERR;
950 
951  }
952  else
953  {
954  switch (fs->fs_type)
955  {
956  case FS_FAT12 :
957  bc = (UINT)clst; bc += bc / 2;
958  res = move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (bc / SS(fs)));
959  if (res != FR_OK) break;
960  p = &fs->win[bc % SS(fs)];
961  *p = (clst & 1) ? ((*p & 0x0F) | ((BYTE)val << 4)) : (BYTE)val;
962  bc++;
963  fs->wflag = 1;
964  res = move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (bc / SS(fs)));
965  if (res != FR_OK) break;
966  p = &fs->win[bc % SS(fs)];
967  *p = (clst & 1) ? (BYTE)(val >> 4) : ((*p & 0xF0) | ((BYTE)(val >> 8) & 0x0F));
968  break;
969 
970  case FS_FAT16 :
971  res = move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 2)));
972  if (res != FR_OK) break;
973  p = &fs->win[clst * 2 % SS(fs)];
974  ST_WORD(p, (WORD)val);
975  break;
976 
977  case FS_FAT32 :
978  res = move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 4)));
979  if (res != FR_OK) break;
980  p = &fs->win[clst * 4 % SS(fs)];
981  val |= LD_DWORD(p) & 0xF0000000;
982  ST_DWORD(p, val);
983  break;
984 
985  default :
986  res = FR_INT_ERR;
987  }
988  fs->wflag = 1;
989  }
990 
991  return res;
992 }
993 #endif /* !_FS_READONLY */
994 
995 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
996 /* FAT handling - Remove a cluster chain */
997 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
998 #if !_FS_READONLY
999 MEMSPACE
1000 static
1001 FRESULT remove_chain (
1002 FATFS* fs, /* File system object */
1003 DWORD clst /* Cluster# to remove a chain from */
1004 )
1005 {
1006  FRESULT res;
1007  DWORD nxt;
1008 #if _USE_ERASE
1009  DWORD scl = clst, ecl = clst, rt[2];
1010 #endif
1011 
1012  if (clst < 2 || clst >= fs->n_fatent) /* Check range */
1013  {
1014  res = FR_INT_ERR;
1015 
1016  }
1017  else
1018  {
1019  res = FR_OK;
1020  while (clst < fs->n_fatent) /* Not a last link? */
1021  {
1022  nxt = get_fat(fs, clst); /* Get cluster status */
1023  if (nxt == 0) break; /* Empty cluster? */
1024  if (nxt == 1) /* Internal error? */
1025  {
1026  res = FR_INT_ERR; break;
1027  }
1028  if (nxt == 0xFFFFFFFF) /* Disk error? */
1029  {
1030  res = FR_DISK_ERR; break;
1031  }
1032  res = put_fat(fs, clst, 0); /* Mark the cluster "empty" */
1033  if (res != FR_OK) break;
1034  if (fs->free_clust != 0xFFFFFFFF) /* Update FSINFO */
1035  {
1036  fs->free_clust++;
1037  fs->fsi_flag |= 1;
1038  }
1039 #if _USE_ERASE
1040  if (ecl + 1 == nxt) /* Is next cluster contiguous? */
1041  {
1042  ecl = nxt;
1043  } /* End of contiguous clusters */
1044  else
1045  {
1046  rt[0] = clust2sect(fs, scl); /* Start sector */
1047 /* End sector */
1048  rt[1] = clust2sect(fs, ecl) + fs->csize - 1;
1049 /* Erase the block */
1050  disk_ioctl(fs->drv, CTRL_ERASE_SECTOR, rt);
1051  scl = ecl = nxt;
1052  }
1053 #endif
1054  clst = nxt; /* Next cluster */
1055  }
1056  }
1057 
1058  return res;
1059 }
1060 #endif
1061 
1062 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1063 /* FAT handling - Stretch or Create a cluster chain */
1064 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1065 #if !_FS_READONLY
1066 MEMSPACE
1067 static
1068 DWORD create_chain ( /* 0:No free cluster, 1:Internal error, 0xFFFFFFFF:Disk error, >=2:New cluster# */
1069 FATFS* fs, /* File system object */
1070 DWORD clst /* Cluster# to stretch. 0 means create a new chain. */
1071 )
1072 {
1073  DWORD cs, ncl, scl;
1074  FRESULT res;
1075 
1076  if (clst == 0) /* Create a new chain */
1077  {
1078  scl = fs->last_clust; /* Get suggested start point */
1079  if (!scl || scl >= fs->n_fatent) scl = 1;
1080  }
1081  else /* Stretch the current chain */
1082  {
1083  cs = get_fat(fs, clst); /* Check the cluster status */
1084  if (cs < 2) return 1; /* Invalid value */
1085  if (cs == 0xFFFFFFFF) return cs; /* A disk error occurred */
1086  if (cs < fs->n_fatent) return cs; /* It is already followed by next cluster */
1087  scl = clst;
1088  }
1089 
1090  ncl = scl; /* Start cluster */
1091  for (;;)
1092  {
1093  ncl++; /* Next cluster */
1094  if (ncl >= fs->n_fatent) /* Check wrap around */
1095  {
1096  ncl = 2;
1097  if (ncl > scl) return 0; /* No free cluster */
1098  }
1099  cs = get_fat(fs, ncl); /* Get the cluster status */
1100  if (cs == 0) break; /* Found a free cluster */
1101  if (cs == 0xFFFFFFFF || cs == 1) /* An error occurred */
1102  return cs;
1103  if (ncl == scl) return 0; /* No free cluster */
1104  }
1105 
1106  res = put_fat(fs, ncl, 0x0FFFFFFF); /* Mark the new cluster "last link" */
1107  if (res == FR_OK && clst != 0)
1108  {
1109  res = put_fat(fs, clst, ncl); /* Link it to the previous one if needed */
1110  }
1111  if (res == FR_OK)
1112  {
1113  fs->last_clust = ncl; /* Update FSINFO */
1114  if (fs->free_clust != 0xFFFFFFFF)
1115  {
1116  fs->free_clust--;
1117  fs->fsi_flag |= 1;
1118  }
1119  }
1120  else
1121  {
1122  ncl = (res == FR_DISK_ERR) ? 0xFFFFFFFF : 1;
1123  }
1124 
1125  return ncl; /* Return new cluster number or error code */
1126 }
1127 #endif /* !_FS_READONLY */
1128 
1129 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1130 /* FAT handling - Convert offset into cluster with link map table */
1131 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1132 
1133 #if _USE_FASTSEEK
1134 MEMSPACE
1135 static
1136 DWORD clmt_clust ( /* <2:Error, >=2:Cluster number */
1137 FIL* fp, /* Pointer to the file object */
1138 DWORD ofs /* File offset to be converted to cluster# */
1139 )
1140 {
1141  DWORD cl, ncl, *tbl;
1142 
1143  tbl = fp->cltbl + 1; /* Top of CLMT */
1144  cl = ofs / SS(fp->fs) / fp->fs->csize; /* Cluster order from top of the file */
1145  for (;;)
1146  {
1147  ncl = *tbl++; /* Number of cluters in the fragment */
1148  if (!ncl) return 0; /* End of table? (error) */
1149  if (cl < ncl) break; /* In this fragment? */
1150  cl -= ncl; tbl++; /* Next fragment */
1151  }
1152  return cl + *tbl; /* Return the cluster number */
1153 }
1154 #endif /* _USE_FASTSEEK */
1155 
1156 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1157 /* Directory handling - Set directory index */
1158 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1159 
1160 MEMSPACE
1161 static
1162 FRESULT dir_sdi (
1163 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to directory object */
1164 UINT idx /* Index of directory table */
1165 )
1166 {
1167  DWORD clst, sect;
1168  UINT ic;
1169 
1170  dp->index = (WORD)idx; /* Current index */
1171  clst = dp->sclust; /* Table start cluster (0:root) */
1172  if (clst == 1 || clst >= dp->fs->n_fatent) /* Check start cluster range */
1173  return FR_INT_ERR;
1174  if (!clst && dp->fs->fs_type == FS_FAT32) /* Replace cluster# 0 with root cluster# if in FAT32 */
1175  clst = dp->fs->dirbase;
1176 
1177  if (clst == 0) /* Static table (root-directory in FAT12/16) */
1178  {
1179  if (idx >= dp->fs->n_rootdir) /* Is index out of range? */
1180  return FR_INT_ERR;
1181  sect = dp->fs->dirbase;
1182  }
1183  else /* Dynamic table (root-directory in FAT32 or sub-directory) */
1184  {
1185  ic = SS(dp->fs) / SZ_DIR * dp->fs->csize; /* Entries per cluster */
1186  while (idx >= ic) /* Follow cluster chain */
1187  {
1188  clst = get_fat(dp->fs, clst); /* Get next cluster */
1189 /* Disk error */
1190  if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF) return FR_DISK_ERR;
1191 /* Reached to end of table or internal error */
1192  if (clst < 2 || clst >= dp->fs->n_fatent)
1193  return FR_INT_ERR;
1194  idx -= ic;
1195  }
1196  sect = clust2sect(dp->fs, clst);
1197  }
1198  dp->clust = clst; /* Current cluster# */
1199  if (!sect) return FR_INT_ERR;
1200  dp->sect = sect + idx / (SS(dp->fs) / SZ_DIR);/* Sector# of the directory entry */
1201 /* Ptr to the entry in the sector */
1202  dp->dir = dp->fs->win + (idx % (SS(dp->fs) / SZ_DIR)) * SZ_DIR;
1203 
1204  return FR_OK;
1205 }
1206 
1207 
1208 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1209 /* Directory handling - Move directory table index next */
1210 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1211 
1212 MEMSPACE
1213 static
1214 FRESULT dir_next ( /* FR_OK:Succeeded, FR_NO_FILE:End of table, FR_DENIED:Could not stretch */
1215 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
1216 int stretch /* 0: Do not stretch table, 1: Stretch table if needed */
1217 )
1218 {
1219  DWORD clst;
1220  UINT i;
1221 
1222  i = dp->index + 1;
1223  if (!(i & 0xFFFF) || !dp->sect) /* Report EOT when index has reached 65535 */
1224  return FR_NO_FILE;
1225 
1226  if (!(i % (SS(dp->fs) / SZ_DIR))) /* Sector changed? */
1227  {
1228  dp->sect++; /* Next sector */
1229 
1230  if (!dp->clust) /* Static table */
1231  {
1232  if (i >= dp->fs->n_rootdir) /* Report EOT if it reached end of static table */
1233  return FR_NO_FILE;
1234  }
1235  else /* Dynamic table */
1236  {
1237 /* Cluster changed? */
1238  if (((i / (SS(dp->fs) / SZ_DIR)) & (dp->fs->csize - 1)) == 0)
1239  {
1240  clst = get_fat(dp->fs, dp->clust);/* Get next cluster */
1241  if (clst <= 1) return FR_INT_ERR;
1242  if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF) return FR_DISK_ERR;
1243  if (clst >= dp->fs->n_fatent) /* If it reached end of dynamic table, */
1244  {
1245 #if !_FS_READONLY
1246  UINT c;
1247 /* If do not stretch, report EOT */
1248  if (!stretch) return FR_NO_FILE;
1249 /* Stretch cluster chain */
1250  clst = create_chain(dp->fs, dp->clust);
1251 /* No free cluster */
1252  if (clst == 0) return FR_DENIED;
1253  if (clst == 1) return FR_INT_ERR;
1254  if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF) return FR_DISK_ERR;
1255 /* Clean-up stretched table */
1256 /* Flush disk access window */
1257  if (sync_window(dp->fs)) return FR_DISK_ERR;
1258 /* Clear window buffer */
1259  mem_set(dp->fs->win, 0, SS(dp->fs));
1260 /* Cluster start sector */
1261  dp->fs->winsect = clust2sect(dp->fs, clst);
1262 /* Fill the new cluster with 0 */
1263  for (c = 0; c < dp->fs->csize; c++)
1264  {
1265  dp->fs->wflag = 1;
1266  if (sync_window(dp->fs)) return FR_DISK_ERR;
1267  dp->fs->winsect++;
1268  }
1269  dp->fs->winsect -= c; /* Rewind window offset */
1270 #else
1271 /* If do not stretch, report EOT (this is to suppress warning) */
1272  if (!stretch) return FR_NO_FILE;
1273  return FR_NO_FILE; /* Report EOT */
1274 #endif
1275  }
1276  dp->clust = clst; /* Initialize data for new cluster */
1277  dp->sect = clust2sect(dp->fs, clst);
1278  }
1279  }
1280  }
1281 
1282  dp->index = (WORD)i; /* Current index */
1283 /* Current entry in the window */
1284  dp->dir = dp->fs->win + (i % (SS(dp->fs) / SZ_DIR)) * SZ_DIR;
1285 
1286  return FR_OK;
1287 }
1288 
1289 
1290 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1291 /* Directory handling - Reserve directory entry */
1292 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1293 
1294 #if !_FS_READONLY
1295 MEMSPACE
1296 static
1297 FRESULT dir_alloc (
1298 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
1299 UINT nent /* Number of contiguous entries to allocate (1-21) */
1300 )
1301 {
1302  FRESULT res;
1303  UINT n;
1304 
1305  res = dir_sdi(dp, 0);
1306  if (res == FR_OK)
1307  {
1308  n = 0;
1309  do
1310  {
1311  res = move_window(dp->fs, dp->sect);
1312  if (res != FR_OK) break;
1313 /* Is it a blank entry? */
1314  if (dp->dir[0] == DDE || dp->dir[0] == 0)
1315  {
1316  if (++n == nent) break; /* A block of contiguous entries is found */
1317  }
1318  else
1319  {
1320  n = 0; /* Not a blank entry. Restart to search */
1321  }
1322  res = dir_next(dp, 1); /* Next entry with table stretch enabled */
1323  } while (res == FR_OK);
1324  }
1325  if (res == FR_NO_FILE) res = FR_DENIED; /* No directory entry to allocate */
1326  return res;
1327 }
1328 #endif
1329 
1330 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1331 /* Directory handling - Load/Store start cluster number */
1332 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1333 
1334 MEMSPACE
1335 static
1336 DWORD ld_clust (
1337 FATFS* fs, /* Pointer to the fs object */
1338 BYTE* dir /* Pointer to the directory entry */
1339 )
1340 {
1341  DWORD cl;
1342 
1343  cl = LD_WORD(dir+DIR_FstClusLO);
1344  if (fs->fs_type == FS_FAT32)
1345  cl |= (DWORD)LD_WORD(dir+DIR_FstClusHI) << 16;
1346 
1347  return cl;
1348 }
1349 
1350 
1351 #if !_FS_READONLY
1352 MEMSPACE
1353 static
1354 void st_clust (
1355 BYTE* dir, /* Pointer to the directory entry */
1356 DWORD cl /* Value to be set */
1357 )
1358 {
1359  ST_WORD(dir+DIR_FstClusLO, cl);
1360  ST_WORD(dir+DIR_FstClusHI, cl >> 16);
1361 }
1362 #endif
1363 
1364 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1365 /* LFN handling - Test/Pick/Fit an LFN segment from/to directory entry */
1366 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1367 #if _USE_LFN
1368 static
1369 const BYTE LfnOfs[] = /* Offset of LFN characters in the directory entry */
1370 {
1371  1,3,5,7,9,14,16,18,20,22,24,28,30
1372 };
1373 
1374 MEMSPACE
1375 static
1376 int cmp_lfn ( /* 1:Matched, 0:Not matched */
1377 WCHAR* lfnbuf, /* Pointer to the LFN to be compared */
1378 BYTE* dir /* Pointer to the directory entry containing a part of LFN */
1379 )
1380 {
1381  UINT i, s;
1382  WCHAR wc, uc;
1383 
1384  i = ((dir[LDIR_Ord] & ~LLE) - 1) * 13; /* Get offset in the LFN buffer */
1385  s = 0; wc = 1;
1386  do
1387  {
1388  uc = LD_WORD(dir+LfnOfs[s]); /* Pick an LFN character from the entry */
1389  if (wc) /* Last character has not been processed */
1390  {
1391  wc = ff_wtoupper(uc); /* Convert it to upper case */
1392 /* Compare it */
1393  if (i >= _MAX_LFN || wc != ff_wtoupper(lfnbuf[i++]))
1394  return 0; /* Not matched */
1395  }
1396  else
1397  {
1398  if (uc != 0xFFFF) return 0; /* Check filler */
1399  }
1400  } while (++s < 13); /* Repeat until all characters in the entry are checked */
1401 
1402  if ((dir[LDIR_Ord] & LLE) && wc && lfnbuf[i]) /* Last segment matched but different length */
1403  return 0;
1404 
1405  return 1; /* The part of LFN matched */
1406 }
1407 
1408 
1409 MEMSPACE
1410 static
1411 int pick_lfn ( /* 1:Succeeded, 0:Buffer overflow */
1412 WCHAR* lfnbuf, /* Pointer to the Unicode-LFN buffer */
1413 BYTE* dir /* Pointer to the directory entry */
1414 )
1415 {
1416  UINT i, s;
1417  WCHAR wc, uc;
1418 
1419  i = ((dir[LDIR_Ord] & 0x3F) - 1) * 13; /* Offset in the LFN buffer */
1420 
1421  s = 0; wc = 1;
1422  do
1423  {
1424  uc = LD_WORD(dir+LfnOfs[s]); /* Pick an LFN character from the entry */
1425  if (wc) /* Last character has not been processed */
1426  {
1427  if (i >= _MAX_LFN) return 0; /* Buffer overflow? */
1428  lfnbuf[i++] = wc = uc; /* Store it */
1429  }
1430  else
1431  {
1432  if (uc != 0xFFFF) return 0; /* Check filler */
1433  }
1434  } while (++s < 13); /* Read all character in the entry */
1435 
1436  if (dir[LDIR_Ord] & LLE) /* Put terminator if it is the last LFN part */
1437  {
1438  if (i >= _MAX_LFN) return 0; /* Buffer overflow? */
1439  lfnbuf[i] = 0;
1440  }
1441 
1442  return 1;
1443 }
1444 
1445 
1446 #if !_FS_READONLY
1447 MEMSPACE
1448 static
1449 void fit_lfn (
1450 const WCHAR* lfnbuf, /* Pointer to the LFN buffer */
1451 BYTE* dir, /* Pointer to the directory entry */
1452 BYTE ord, /* LFN order (1-20) */
1453 BYTE sum /* SFN sum */
1454 )
1455 {
1456  UINT i, s;
1457  WCHAR wc;
1458 
1459  dir[LDIR_Chksum] = sum; /* Set check sum */
1460  dir[LDIR_Attr] = AM_LFN; /* Set attribute. LFN entry */
1461  dir[LDIR_Type] = 0;
1462  ST_WORD(dir+LDIR_FstClusLO, 0);
1463 
1464  i = (ord - 1) * 13; /* Get offset in the LFN buffer */
1465  s = wc = 0;
1466  do
1467  {
1468  if (wc != 0xFFFF) wc = lfnbuf[i++]; /* Get an effective character */
1469  ST_WORD(dir+LfnOfs[s], wc); /* Put it */
1470  if (!wc) wc = 0xFFFF; /* Padding characters following last character */
1471  } while (++s < 13);
1472  if (wc == 0xFFFF || !lfnbuf[i]) ord |= LLE; /* Bottom LFN part is the start of LFN sequence */
1473  dir[LDIR_Ord] = ord; /* Set the LFN order */
1474 }
1475 #endif
1476 #endif
1477 
1478 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1479 /* Create numbered name */
1480 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1481 #if _USE_LFN
1482 MEMSPACE
1483 static
1484 void gen_numname (
1485 BYTE* dst, /* Pointer to the buffer to store numbered SFN */
1486 const BYTE* src, /* Pointer to SFN */
1487 const WCHAR* lfn, /* Pointer to LFN */
1488 UINT seq /* Sequence number */
1489 )
1490 {
1491  BYTE ns[8], c;
1492  UINT i, j;
1493 
1494  mem_cpy(dst, src, 11);
1495 
1496  if (seq > 5) /* On many collisions, generate a hash number instead of sequential number */
1497  {
1498  WCHAR wc;
1499  DWORD sr = seq;
1500 
1501  while (*lfn) /* Create a CRC */
1502  {
1503  wc = *lfn++;
1504  for (i = 0; i < 16; i++)
1505  {
1506  sr = (sr << 1) + (wc & 1);
1507  wc >>= 1;
1508  if (sr & 0x10000) sr ^= 0x11021;
1509  }
1510  }
1511  seq = (UINT)sr;
1512  }
1513 
1514 /* itoa (hexdecimal) */
1515  i = 7;
1516  do
1517  {
1518  c = (seq % 16) + '0';
1519  if (c > '9') c += 7;
1520  ns[i--] = c;
1521  seq /= 16;
1522  } while (seq);
1523  ns[i] = '~';
1524 
1525 /* Append the number */
1526  for (j = 0; j < i && dst[j] != ' '; j++)
1527  {
1528  if (IsDBCS1(dst[j]))
1529  {
1530  if (j == i - 1) break;
1531  j++;
1532  }
1533  }
1534  do
1535  {
1536  dst[j++] = (i < 8) ? ns[i++] : ' ';
1537  } while (j < 8);
1538 }
1539 #endif
1540 
1541 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1542 /* Calculate sum of an SFN */
1543 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1544 #if _USE_LFN
1545 MEMSPACE
1546 static
1547 BYTE sum_sfn (
1548 const BYTE* dir /* Pointer to the SFN entry */
1549 )
1550 {
1551  BYTE sum = 0;
1552  UINT n = 11;
1553 
1554  do sum = (sum >> 1) + (sum << 7) + *dir++; while (--n);
1555  return sum;
1556 }
1557 #endif
1558 
1559 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1560 /* Directory handling - Find an object in the directory */
1561 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1562 
1563 MEMSPACE
1564 static
1565 FRESULT dir_find (
1566 DIR* dp /* Pointer to the directory object linked to the file name */
1567 )
1568 {
1569  FRESULT res;
1570  BYTE c, *dir;
1571 #if _USE_LFN
1572  BYTE a, ord, sum;
1573 #endif
1574 
1575  res = dir_sdi(dp, 0); /* Rewind directory object */
1576  if (res != FR_OK) return res;
1577 
1578 #if _USE_LFN
1579  ord = sum = 0xFF; dp->lfn_idx = 0xFFFF; /* Reset LFN sequence */
1580 #endif
1581  do
1582  {
1583  res = move_window(dp->fs, dp->sect);
1584  if (res != FR_OK) break;
1585  dir = dp->dir; /* Ptr to the directory entry of current index */
1586  c = dir[DIR_Name];
1587  if (c == 0) /* Reached to end of table */
1588  {
1589  res = FR_NO_FILE; break;
1590  }
1591 #if _USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
1592  a = dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_MASK;
1593 /* An entry without valid data */
1594  if (c == DDE || ((a & AM_VOL) && a != AM_LFN))
1595  {
1596  ord = 0xFF; dp->lfn_idx = 0xFFFF; /* Reset LFN sequence */
1597  }
1598  else
1599  {
1600  if (a == AM_LFN) /* An LFN entry is found */
1601  {
1602  if (dp->lfn)
1603  {
1604  if (c & LLE) /* Is it start of LFN sequence? */
1605  {
1606  sum = dir[LDIR_Chksum];
1607  c &= ~LLE; ord = c; /* LFN start order */
1608  dp->lfn_idx = dp->index; /* Start index of LFN */
1609  }
1610 /* Check validity of the LFN entry and compare it with given name */
1611  ord = (c == ord && sum == dir[LDIR_Chksum] && cmp_lfn(dp->lfn, dir)) ? ord - 1 : 0xFF;
1612  }
1613  } /* An SFN entry is found */
1614  else
1615  {
1616 /* LFN matched? */
1617  if (!ord && sum == sum_sfn(dir)) break;
1618 /* SFN matched? */
1619  if (!(dp->fn[NS] & NS_LOSS) && !mem_cmp(dir, dp->fn, 11)) break;
1620  ord = 0xFF; dp->lfn_idx = 0xFFFF; /* Reset LFN sequence */
1621  }
1622  }
1623 #else /* Non LFN configuration */
1624 /* Is it a valid entry? */
1625  if (!(dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_VOL) && !mem_cmp(dir, dp->fn, 11))
1626  break;
1627 #endif
1628  res = dir_next(dp, 0); /* Next entry */
1629  } while (res == FR_OK);
1630 
1631  return res;
1632 }
1633 
1634 
1635 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1636 /* Read an object from the directory */
1637 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1638 #if _FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || _USE_LABEL || _FS_RPATH >= 2
1639 MEMSPACE
1640 static
1641 FRESULT dir_read (
1642 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
1643 int vol /* Filtered by 0:file/directory or 1:volume label */
1644 )
1645 {
1646  FRESULT res;
1647  BYTE a, c, *dir;
1648 #if _USE_LFN
1649  BYTE ord = 0xFF, sum = 0xFF;
1650 #endif
1651 
1652  res = FR_NO_FILE;
1653  while (dp->sect)
1654  {
1655  res = move_window(dp->fs, dp->sect);
1656  if (res != FR_OK) break;
1657  dir = dp->dir; /* Ptr to the directory entry of current index */
1658  c = dir[DIR_Name];
1659  if (c == 0) /* Reached to end of table */
1660  {
1661  res = FR_NO_FILE; break;
1662  }
1663  a = dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_MASK;
1664 #if _USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
1665 /* An entry without valid data */
1666  if (c == DDE || (!_FS_RPATH && c == '.') || (int)(a == AM_VOL) != vol)
1667  {
1668  ord = 0xFF;
1669  }
1670  else
1671  {
1672  if (a == AM_LFN) /* An LFN entry is found */
1673  {
1674  if (c & LLE) /* Is it start of LFN sequence? */
1675  {
1676  sum = dir[LDIR_Chksum];
1677  c &= ~LLE; ord = c;
1678  dp->lfn_idx = dp->index;
1679  }
1680 /* Check LFN validity and capture it */
1681  ord = (c == ord && sum == dir[LDIR_Chksum] && pick_lfn(dp->lfn, dir)) ? ord - 1 : 0xFF;
1682  } /* An SFN entry is found */
1683  else
1684  {
1685  if (ord || sum != sum_sfn(dir)) /* Is there a valid LFN? */
1686  dp->lfn_idx = 0xFFFF; /* It has no LFN. */
1687  break;
1688  }
1689  }
1690 #else /* Non LFN configuration */
1691 /* Is it a valid entry? */
1692  if (c != DDE && (_FS_RPATH || c != '.') && a != AM_LFN && (int)(a == AM_VOL) == vol)
1693  break;
1694 #endif
1695  res = dir_next(dp, 0); /* Next entry */
1696  if (res != FR_OK) break;
1697  }
1698 
1699  if (res != FR_OK) dp->sect = 0;
1700 
1701  return res;
1702 }
1703 #endif /* _FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || _USE_LABEL || _FS_RPATH >= 2 */
1704 
1705 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1706 /* Register an object to the directory */
1707 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1708 #if !_FS_READONLY
1709 MEMSPACE
1710 static
1711 FRESULT dir_register ( /* FR_OK:Successful, FR_DENIED:No free entry or too many SFN collision, FR_DISK_ERR:Disk error */
1712 DIR* dp /* Target directory with object name to be created */
1713 )
1714 {
1715  FRESULT res;
1716 #if _USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
1717  UINT n, nent;
1718  BYTE sn[12], *fn, sum;
1719  WCHAR *lfn;
1720 
1721  fn = dp->fn; lfn = dp->lfn;
1722  mem_cpy(sn, fn, 12);
1723 
1724  if (_FS_RPATH && (sn[NS] & NS_DOT)) /* Cannot create dot entry */
1725  return FR_INVALID_NAME;
1726 
1727  if (sn[NS] & NS_LOSS) /* When LFN is out of 8.3 format, generate a numbered name */
1728  {
1729  fn[NS] = 0; dp->lfn = 0; /* Find only SFN */
1730  for (n = 1; n < 100; n++)
1731  {
1732  gen_numname(fn, sn, lfn, n); /* Generate a numbered name */
1733  res = dir_find(dp); /* Check if the name collides with existing SFN */
1734  if (res != FR_OK) break;
1735  }
1736  if (n == 100) return FR_DENIED; /* Abort if too many collisions */
1737  if (res != FR_NO_FILE) return res; /* Abort if the result is other than 'not collided' */
1738  fn[NS] = sn[NS]; dp->lfn = lfn;
1739  }
1740 
1741  if (sn[NS] & NS_LFN) /* When LFN is to be created, allocate entries for an SFN + LFNs. */
1742  {
1743  for (n = 0; lfn[n]; n++) ;
1744  nent = (n + 25) / 13;
1745  } /* Otherwise allocate an entry for an SFN */
1746  else
1747  {
1748  nent = 1;
1749  }
1750  res = dir_alloc(dp, nent); /* Allocate entries */
1751 
1752  if (res == FR_OK && --nent) /* Set LFN entry if needed */
1753  {
1754  res = dir_sdi(dp, dp->index - nent);
1755  if (res == FR_OK)
1756  {
1757  sum = sum_sfn(dp->fn); /* Sum value of the SFN tied to the LFN */
1758  do /* Store LFN entries in bottom first */
1759  {
1760  res = move_window(dp->fs, dp->sect);
1761  if (res != FR_OK) break;
1762  fit_lfn(dp->lfn, dp->dir, (BYTE)nent, sum);
1763  dp->fs->wflag = 1;
1764  res = dir_next(dp, 0); /* Next entry */
1765  } while (res == FR_OK && --nent);
1766  }
1767  }
1768 #else /* Non LFN configuration */
1769  res = dir_alloc(dp, 1); /* Allocate an entry for SFN */
1770 #endif
1771 
1772  if (res == FR_OK) /* Set SFN entry */
1773  {
1774  res = move_window(dp->fs, dp->sect);
1775  if (res == FR_OK)
1776  {
1777  mem_set(dp->dir, 0, SZ_DIR); /* Clean the entry */
1778  mem_cpy(dp->dir, dp->fn, 11); /* Put SFN */
1779 #if _USE_LFN
1780 /* Put NT flag */
1781  dp->dir[DIR_NTres] = dp->fn[NS] & (NS_BODY | NS_EXT);
1782 #endif
1783  dp->fs->wflag = 1;
1784  }
1785  }
1786 
1787  return res;
1788 }
1789 #endif /* !_FS_READONLY */
1790 
1791 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1792 /* Remove an object from the directory */
1793 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1794 #if !_FS_READONLY && !_FS_MINIMIZE
1795 MEMSPACE
1796 static
1797 FRESULT dir_remove ( /* FR_OK: Successful, FR_DISK_ERR: A disk error */
1798 DIR* dp /* Directory object pointing the entry to be removed */
1799 )
1800 {
1801  FRESULT res;
1802 #if _USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
1803  UINT i;
1804 
1805  i = dp->index; /* SFN index */
1806 /* Goto the SFN or top of the LFN entries */
1807  res = dir_sdi(dp, (dp->lfn_idx == 0xFFFF) ? i : dp->lfn_idx);
1808  if (res == FR_OK)
1809  {
1810  do
1811  {
1812  res = move_window(dp->fs, dp->sect);
1813  if (res != FR_OK) break;
1814  mem_set(dp->dir, 0, SZ_DIR); /* Clear and mark the entry "deleted" */
1815  *dp->dir = DDE;
1816  dp->fs->wflag = 1;
1817  if (dp->index >= i) break; /* When reached SFN, all entries of the object has been deleted. */
1818  res = dir_next(dp, 0); /* Next entry */
1819  } while (res == FR_OK);
1820  if (res == FR_NO_FILE) res = FR_INT_ERR;
1821  }
1822 
1823 #else /* Non LFN configuration */
1824  res = dir_sdi(dp, dp->index);
1825  if (res == FR_OK)
1826  {
1827  res = move_window(dp->fs, dp->sect);
1828  if (res == FR_OK)
1829  {
1830  mem_set(dp->dir, 0, SZ_DIR); /* Clear and mark the entry "deleted" */
1831  *dp->dir = DDE;
1832  dp->fs->wflag = 1;
1833  }
1834  }
1835 #endif
1836 
1837  return res;
1838 }
1839 #endif /* !_FS_READONLY */
1840 
1841 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1842 /* Get file information from directory entry */
1843 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1844 #if _FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || _FS_RPATH >= 2
1845 MEMSPACE
1846 static
1847 void get_fileinfo ( /* No return code */
1848 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
1849 FILINFO* fno /* Pointer to the file information to be filled */
1850 )
1851 {
1852  UINT i;
1853  TCHAR *p, c;
1854 
1855  p = fno->fname;
1856  if (dp->sect) /* Get SFN */
1857  {
1858  BYTE *dir = dp->dir;
1859 
1860  i = 0;
1861  while (i < 11) /* Copy name body and extension */
1862  {
1863  c = (TCHAR)dir[i++];
1864  if (c == ' ') continue; /* Skip padding spaces */
1865  if (c == NDDE) c = (TCHAR)DDE; /* Restore replaced DDE character */
1866  if (i == 9) *p++ = '.'; /* Insert a . if extension is exist */
1867 #if _USE_LFN
1868  if (IsUpper(c) && (dir[DIR_NTres] & (i >= 9 ? NS_EXT : NS_BODY)))
1869  c += 0x20; /* To lower */
1870 #if _LFN_UNICODE
1871  if (IsDBCS1(c) && i != 8 && i != 11 && IsDBCS2(dir[i]))
1872  c = c << 8 | dir[i++];
1873  c = ff_convert(c, 1); /* OEM -> Unicode */
1874  if (!c) c = '?';
1875 #endif
1876 #endif
1877  *p++ = c;
1878  }
1879  fno->fattrib = dir[DIR_Attr]; /* Attribute */
1880  fno->fsize = LD_DWORD(dir+DIR_FileSize); /* Size */
1881  fno->fdate = LD_WORD(dir+DIR_WrtDate); /* Date */
1882  fno->ftime = LD_WORD(dir+DIR_WrtTime); /* Time */
1883  }
1884  *p = 0; /* Terminate SFN string by a \0 */
1885 
1886 #if _USE_LFN
1887  if (fno->lfname)
1888  {
1889  WCHAR w, *lfn;
1890 
1891  i = 0; p = fno->lfname;
1892 /* Get LFN if available */
1893  if (dp->sect && fno->lfsize && dp->lfn_idx != 0xFFFF)
1894  {
1895  lfn = dp->lfn;
1896  while ((w = *lfn++) != 0) /* Get an LFN character */
1897  {
1898 #if !_LFN_UNICODE
1899  w = ff_convert(w, 0); /* Unicode -> OEM */
1900  if (!w) /* No LFN if it could not be converted */
1901  {
1902  i = 0; break;
1903  }
1904  if (_DF1S && w >= 0x100) /* Put 1st byte if it is a DBC (always false on SBCS cfg) */
1905  p[i++] = (TCHAR)(w >> 8);
1906 #endif
1907  if (i >= fno->lfsize - 1) /* No LFN if buffer overflow */
1908  {
1909  i = 0; break;
1910  }
1911  p[i++] = (TCHAR)w;
1912  }
1913  }
1914  p[i] = 0; /* Terminate LFN string by a \0 */
1915  }
1916 #endif
1917 }
1918 #endif /* _FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || _FS_RPATH >= 2*/
1919 
1920 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1921 /* Pick a segment and create the object name in directory form */
1922 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1923 
1924 MEMSPACE
1925 static
1926 FRESULT create_name (
1927 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
1928 const TCHAR** path /* Pointer to pointer to the segment in the path string */
1929 )
1930 {
1931 #if _USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
1932  BYTE b, cf;
1933  WCHAR w, *lfn;
1934  UINT i, ni, si, di;
1935  const TCHAR *p;
1936 
1937 /* Create LFN in Unicode */
1938 /* Strip duplicated separator */
1939  for (p = *path; *p == '/' || *p == '\\'; p++) ;
1940  lfn = dp->lfn;
1941  si = di = 0;
1942  for (;;)
1943  {
1944  w = p[si++]; /* Get a character */
1945 /* Break on end of segment */
1946  if (w < ' ' || w == '/' || w == '\\') break;
1947  if (di >= _MAX_LFN) /* Reject too long name */
1948  return FR_INVALID_NAME;
1949 #if !_LFN_UNICODE
1950  w &= 0xFF;
1951  if (IsDBCS1(w)) /* Check if it is a DBC 1st byte (always false on SBCS cfg) */
1952  {
1953  b = (BYTE)p[si++]; /* Get 2nd byte */
1954  if (!IsDBCS2(b))
1955  return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject invalid sequence */
1956  w = (w << 8) + b; /* Create a DBC */
1957  }
1958  w = ff_convert(w, 1); /* Convert ANSI/OEM to Unicode */
1959  if (!w) return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject invalid code */
1960 #endif
1961 /* Reject illegal characters for LFN */
1962  if (w < 0x80 && chk_chr("\"*:<>\?|\x7F", w))
1963  return FR_INVALID_NAME;
1964  lfn[di++] = w; /* Store the Unicode character */
1965  }
1966  *path = &p[si]; /* Return pointer to the next segment */
1967  cf = (w < ' ') ? NS_LAST : 0; /* Set last segment flag if end of path */
1968 #if _FS_RPATH
1969  if ((di == 1 && lfn[di-1] == '.') || /* Is this a dot entry? */
1970  (di == 2 && lfn[di-1] == '.' && lfn[di-2] == '.'))
1971  {
1972  lfn[di] = 0;
1973  for (i = 0; i < 11; i++)
1974  dp->fn[i] = (i < di) ? '.' : ' ';
1975  dp->fn[i] = cf | NS_DOT; /* This is a dot entry */
1976  return FR_OK;
1977  }
1978 #endif
1979  while (di) /* Strip trailing spaces and dots */
1980  {
1981  w = lfn[di-1];
1982  if (w != ' ' && w != '.') break;
1983  di--;
1984  }
1985  if (!di) return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject nul string */
1986 
1987  lfn[di] = 0; /* LFN is created */
1988 
1989 /* Create SFN in directory form */
1990  mem_set(dp->fn, ' ', 11);
1991 /* Strip leading spaces and dots */
1992  for (si = 0; lfn[si] == ' ' || lfn[si] == '.'; si++) ;
1993  if (si) cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN;
1994  while (di && lfn[di - 1] != '.') di--; /* Find extension (di<=si: no extension) */
1995 
1996  b = i = 0; ni = 8;
1997  for (;;)
1998  {
1999  w = lfn[si++]; /* Get an LFN character */
2000  if (!w) break; /* Break on end of the LFN */
2001  if (w == ' ' || (w == '.' && si != di)) /* Remove spaces and dots */
2002  {
2003  cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN; continue;
2004  }
2005 
2006  if (i >= ni || si == di) /* Extension or end of SFN */
2007  {
2008  if (ni == 11) /* Long extension */
2009  {
2010  cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN; break;
2011  }
2012  if (si != di) cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN; /* Out of 8.3 format */
2013  if (si > di) break; /* No extension */
2014  si = di; i = 8; ni = 11; /* Enter extension section */
2015  b <<= 2; continue;
2016  }
2017 
2018  if (w >= 0x80) /* Non ASCII character */
2019  {
2020 #ifdef _EXCVT
2021  w = ff_convert(w, 0); /* Unicode -> OEM code */
2022  if (w) w = ExCvt[w - 0x80]; /* Convert extended character to upper (SBCS) */
2023 #else
2024  w = ff_convert(ff_wtoupper(w), 0); /* Upper converted Unicode -> OEM code */
2025 #endif
2026  cf |= NS_LFN; /* Force create LFN entry */
2027  }
2028 
2029  if (_DF1S && w >= 0x100) /* Double byte character (always false on SBCS cfg) */
2030  {
2031  if (i >= ni - 1)
2032  {
2033  cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN; i = ni; continue;
2034  }
2035  dp->fn[i++] = (BYTE)(w >> 8);
2036  } /* Single byte character */
2037  else
2038  {
2039  if (!w || chk_chr("+,;=[]", w)) /* Replace illegal characters for SFN */
2040  {
2041  w = '_'; cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN; /* Lossy conversion */
2042  }
2043  else
2044  {
2045  if (IsUpper(w)) /* ASCII large capital */
2046  {
2047  b |= 2;
2048  }
2049  else
2050  {
2051  if (IsLower(w)) /* ASCII small capital */
2052  {
2053  b |= 1; w -= 0x20;
2054  }
2055  }
2056  }
2057  }
2058  dp->fn[i++] = (BYTE)w;
2059  }
2060 
2061  if (dp->fn[0] == DDE) dp->fn[0] = NDDE; /* If the first character collides with deleted mark, replace it with 0x05 */
2062 
2063  if (ni == 8) b <<= 2;
2064  if ((b & 0x0C) == 0x0C || (b & 0x03) == 0x03) /* Create LFN entry when there are composite capitals */
2065  cf |= NS_LFN;
2066  if (!(cf & NS_LFN)) /* When LFN is in 8.3 format without extended character, NT flags are created */
2067  {
2068  if ((b & 0x03) == 0x01) cf |= NS_EXT; /* NT flag (Extension has only small capital) */
2069  if ((b & 0x0C) == 0x04) cf |= NS_BODY; /* NT flag (Filename has only small capital) */
2070  }
2071 
2072  dp->fn[NS] = cf; /* SFN is created */
2073 
2074  return FR_OK;
2075 
2076 #else /* Non-LFN configuration */
2077  BYTE b, c, d, *sfn;
2078  UINT ni, si, i;
2079  const char *p;
2080 
2081 /* Create file name in directory form */
2082 /* Strip duplicated separator */
2083  for (p = *path; *p == '/' || *p == '\\'; p++) ;
2084  sfn = dp->fn;
2085  mem_set(sfn, ' ', 11);
2086  si = i = b = 0; ni = 8;
2087 #if _FS_RPATH
2088  if (p[si] == '.') /* Is this a dot entry? */
2089  {
2090  for (;;)
2091  {
2092  c = (BYTE)p[si++];
2093  if (c != '.' || si >= 3) break;
2094  sfn[i++] = c;
2095  }
2096  if (c != '/' && c != '\\' && c > ' ') return FR_INVALID_NAME;
2097  *path = &p[si]; /* Return pointer to the next segment */
2098 /* Set last segment flag if end of path */
2099  sfn[NS] = (c <= ' ') ? NS_LAST | NS_DOT : NS_DOT;
2100  return FR_OK;
2101  }
2102 #endif
2103  for (;;)
2104  {
2105  c = (BYTE)p[si++];
2106 /* Break on end of segment */
2107  if (c <= ' ' || c == '/' || c == '\\') break;
2108  if (c == '.' || i >= ni)
2109  {
2110  if (ni != 8 || c != '.') return FR_INVALID_NAME;
2111  i = 8; ni = 11;
2112  b <<= 2; continue;
2113  }
2114  if (c >= 0x80) /* Extended character? */
2115  {
2116  b |= 3; /* Eliminate NT flag */
2117 #ifdef _EXCVT
2118  c = ExCvt[c - 0x80]; /* To upper extended characters (SBCS cfg) */
2119 #else
2120 #if !_DF1S
2121  return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject extended characters (ASCII cfg) */
2122 #endif
2123 #endif
2124  }
2125  if (IsDBCS1(c)) /* Check if it is a DBC 1st byte (always false on SBCS cfg) */
2126  {
2127  d = (BYTE)p[si++]; /* Get 2nd byte */
2128  if (!IsDBCS2(d) || i >= ni - 1) /* Reject invalid DBC */
2129  return FR_INVALID_NAME;
2130  sfn[i++] = c;
2131  sfn[i++] = d;
2132  } /* Single byte code */
2133  else
2134  {
2135  if (chk_chr("\"*+,:;<=>\?[]|\x7F", c))/* Reject illegal chrs for SFN */
2136  return FR_INVALID_NAME;
2137  if (IsUpper(c)) /* ASCII large capital? */
2138  {
2139  b |= 2;
2140  }
2141  else
2142  {
2143  if (IsLower(c)) /* ASCII small capital? */
2144  {
2145  b |= 1; c -= 0x20;
2146  }
2147  }
2148  sfn[i++] = c;
2149  }
2150  }
2151  *path = &p[si]; /* Return pointer to the next segment */
2152  c = (c <= ' ') ? NS_LAST : 0; /* Set last segment flag if end of path */
2153 
2154  if (!i) return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject nul string */
2155  if (sfn[0] == DDE) sfn[0] = NDDE; /* When first character collides with DDE, replace it with 0x05 */
2156 
2157  if (ni == 8) b <<= 2;
2158  if ((b & 0x03) == 0x01) c |= NS_EXT; /* NT flag (Name extension has only small capital) */
2159  if ((b & 0x0C) == 0x04) c |= NS_BODY; /* NT flag (Name body has only small capital) */
2160 
2161  sfn[NS] = c; /* Store NT flag, File name is created */
2162 
2163  return FR_OK;
2164 #endif
2165 }
2166 
2167 
2168 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2169 /* Follow a file path */
2170 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2171 
2172 MEMSPACE
2173 static
2174 FRESULT follow_path ( /* FR_OK(0): successful, !=0: error code */
2175 DIR* dp, /* Directory object to return last directory and found object */
2176 const TCHAR* path /* Full-path string to find a file or directory */
2177 )
2178 {
2179  FRESULT res;
2180  BYTE *dir, ns;
2181 
2182 #if _FS_RPATH
2183  if (*path == '/' || *path == '\\') /* There is a heading separator */
2184  {
2185  path++; dp->sclust = 0; /* Strip it and start from the root directory */
2186  } /* No heading separator */
2187  else
2188  {
2189  dp->sclust = dp->fs->cdir; /* Start from the current directory */
2190  }
2191 #else
2192  if (*path == '/' || *path == '\\') /* Strip heading separator if exist */
2193  path++;
2194  dp->sclust = 0; /* Always start from the root directory */
2195 #endif
2196 
2197  if ((UINT)*path < ' ') /* Null path name is the origin directory itself */
2198  {
2199  res = dir_sdi(dp, 0);
2200  dp->dir = 0;
2201  } /* Follow path */
2202  else
2203  {
2204  for (;;)
2205  {
2206  res = create_name(dp, &path); /* Get a segment name of the path */
2207  if (res != FR_OK) break;
2208  res = dir_find(dp); /* Find an object with the sagment name */
2209  ns = dp->fn[NS];
2210  if (res != FR_OK) /* Failed to find the object */
2211  {
2212  if (res == FR_NO_FILE) /* Object is not found */
2213  {
2214 /* If dot entry is not exist, */
2215  if (_FS_RPATH && (ns & NS_DOT))
2216  {
2217 /* it is the root directory and stay there */
2218  dp->sclust = 0; dp->dir = 0;
2219 /* Continue to follow if not last segment */
2220  if (!(ns & NS_LAST)) continue;
2221  res = FR_OK; /* Ended at the root directroy. Function completed. */
2222  } /* Could not find the object */
2223  else
2224  {
2225 /* Adjust error code if not last segment */
2226  if (!(ns & NS_LAST)) res = FR_NO_PATH;
2227  }
2228  }
2229  break;
2230  }
2231  if (ns & NS_LAST) break; /* Last segment matched. Function completed. */
2232  dir = dp->dir; /* Follow the sub-directory */
2233  if (!(dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_DIR)) /* It is not a sub-directory and cannot follow */
2234  {
2235  res = FR_NO_PATH; break;
2236  }
2237  dp->sclust = ld_clust(dp->fs, dir);
2238  }
2239  }
2240 
2241  return res;
2242 }
2243 
2244 
2245 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2246 /* Get logical drive number from path name */
2247 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2248 
2249 MEMSPACE
2250 static
2251 int get_ldnumber ( /* Returns logical drive number (-1:invalid drive) */
2252 const TCHAR** path /* Pointer to pointer to the path name */
2253 )
2254 {
2255  const TCHAR *tp, *tt;
2256  UINT i;
2257  int vol = -1;
2258 
2259  if (*path) /* If the pointer is not a null */
2260  {
2261 /* Find ':' in the path */
2262  for (tt = *path; (UINT)*tt >= (_USE_LFN ? ' ' : '!') && *tt != ':'; tt++) ;
2263  if (*tt == ':') /* If a ':' is exist in the path name */
2264  {
2265  tp = *path;
2266  i = *tp++ - '0';
2267  if (i < 10 && tp == tt) /* Is there a numeric drive id? */
2268  {
2269  if (i < _VOLUMES) /* If a drive id is found, get the value and strip it */
2270  {
2271  vol = (int)i;
2272  *path = ++tt;
2273  }
2274  } /* No numeric drive number */
2275  else
2276  {
2277 #if _STR_VOLUME_ID /* Find string drive id */
2278  static const char* const str[] = {_VOLUME_STRS};
2279  const char *sp;
2280  char c;
2281  TCHAR tc;
2282 
2283  i = 0; tt++;
2284  do
2285  {
2286  sp = str[i]; tp = *path;
2287  do /* Compare a string drive id with path name */
2288  {
2289  c = *sp++; tc = *tp++;
2290  if (IsLower(tc)) tc -= 0x20;
2291  } while (c && (TCHAR)c == tc);
2292 /* Repeat for each id until pattern match */
2293  } while ((c || tp != tt) && ++i < _VOLUMES);
2294  if (i < _VOLUMES) /* If a drive id is found, get the value and strip it */
2295  {
2296  vol = (int)i;
2297  *path = tt;
2298  }
2299 #endif
2300  }
2301  return vol;
2302  }
2303 #if _FS_RPATH && _VOLUMES >= 2
2304  vol = CurrVol; /* Current drive */
2305 #else
2306  vol = 0; /* Drive 0 */
2307 #endif
2308  }
2309  return vol;
2310 }
